headline: It Looked Like A Scam Email Asking To Venmo $100. Then He Realized It Was A Mandatory Contribution To A Lavish Gift For The Boss
summary: A manager at a successful small business was stunned to receive what looked like a phishing email: a request to Venmo $100 to the company president. The supposed reason? A group gift for the owner. But it wasn’t a scam. It was real. And, apparently, not optional. Managers Were Expected To Chip In The Reddit post, shared under r/smallbusiness, came from an employee who had only been at the 80-person company for less than a year. The business brings in around $50 million in revenue and has no debt

content.title: It Looked Like A Scam Email Asking To Venmo $100. Then He Realized It Was A Mandatory Contribution To A Lavish Gift For The Boss
content.summary: A manager at a successful small business was stunned to receive what looked like a phishing email: a request to Venmo $100 to the company president. The supposed reason? A group gift for the owner. But it wasn’t a scam. It was real. And, apparently, not optional. Managers Were Expected To Chip In The Reddit post, shared under r/smallbusiness, came from an employee who had only been at the 80-person company for less than a year. The business brings in around $50 million in revenue and has no debt

headline: Amazon plans new one-hour pickup service in stores, Business Insider reports
summary: Amazon is developing a "rush" pickup service that would let customers collect ​orders from its stores within an ‌hour, Business Insider reported on Thursday, citing an internal document ‌and a person familiar with the matter.  The feature would allow shoppers to place a "unified" order combining items from Amazon's online store and its ⁠physical outlets, according ‌to the report.  The e-commerce giant plans to pilot the program in at ​least one metropolitan area by early 2026, ‌though the timeline may have changed, Business Insider reported.

content.title: Amazon plans new one-hour pickup service in stores, Business Insider reports
content.summary: Amazon is developing a "rush" pickup service that would let customers collect ​orders from its stores within an ‌hour, Business Insider reported on Thursday, citing an internal document ‌and a person familiar with the matter.  The feature would allow shoppers to place a "unified" order combining items from Amazon's online store and its ⁠physical outlets, according ‌to the report.  The e-commerce giant plans to pilot the program in at ​least one metropolitan area by early 2026, ‌though the timeline may have changed, Business Insider reported.

headline: Oracle shares tumble as gloomy forecasts, higher capex reignite AI bubble concerns
summary: Oracle shares slumped nearly 12% on Thursday, dragging other technology stocks, as concerns mounted about the company's massive AI spending and ​the lack of a clear timeline on returns from the investments.  Its peers such ‌as Nvidia, Microsoft , Micron, and CoreWeave  were down between 0.4% and 4.4% in premarket trading.  In a bid ⁠to compete with industry giants ‌like Amazon, Microsoft and Google, Oracle has signed cloud-computing deals with OpenAI and others which has helped the stock climb nearly 34% this year.

content.title: Oracle shares tumble as gloomy forecasts, higher capex reignite AI bubble concerns
content.summary: Oracle shares slumped nearly 12% on Thursday, dragging other technology stocks, as concerns mounted about the company's massive AI spending and ​the lack of a clear timeline on returns from the investments.  Its peers such ‌as Nvidia, Microsoft , Micron, and CoreWeave  were down between 0.4% and 4.4% in premarket trading.  In a bid ⁠to compete with industry giants ‌like Amazon, Microsoft and Google, Oracle has signed cloud-computing deals with OpenAI and others which has helped the stock climb nearly 34% this year.

headline: Microsoft fights $2.8 billion UK lawsuit over cloud computing licences
summary: LONDON, Dec 11 () - Microsoft was on Thursday accused of overcharging thousands of British businesses to use Windows Server software on ​cloud computing services provided by Amazon, Google and Alibaba, at a ‌pivotal hearing in a 2. Regulators in Britain, Europe and the United States ‌have separately begun examining Microsoft and others' practices in relation to cloud computing.

headline: Microsoft CEO Warns That Leaders Without Emotional Intelligence Will Fall Behind In AI Race, Says 'It's Just A Waste Of IQ'
summary: The growing pressure inside the AI boom is raising questions about how leadership must evolve, a shift highlighting the need for emotional intelligence in high-stakes decision-making. headline: SpaceX $1.5T value target hinges on Starlink — and Elon
summary: SpaceX is planning an initial public offering that may be the world’s biggest ever.  Of listed firms with similar characteristics, only Palantir Technologies Inc. comes close, at about 70 times.  The near-term investment case is that Starlink and a nascent mobile phone service fueled by its acquisition of spectrum from EchoStar Corp. provide the foundation for the outsize growth that IPO buyers will demand.

content.title: SpaceX $1.5T value target hinges on Starlink — and Elon
content.summary: SpaceX is planning an initial public offering that may be the world’s biggest ever.  Of listed firms with similar characteristics, only Palantir Technologies Inc. comes close, at about 70 times.  The near-term investment case is that Starlink and a nascent mobile phone service fueled by its acquisition of spectrum from EchoStar Corp. provide the foundation for the outsize growth that IPO buyers will demand.

content.title: Roku Stock Is a Top Pick for 2026 at 2 Wall Street Firms. Here’s Why.
content.summary: While  Netflix  and  Paramount Skydance  duke it out over  Warner Bros. Discovery  analysts say  Roku  stock remains an under-the-radar option in the streaming industry.  Jefferies upgraded  Roku  shares to Buy from Hold and lifted its price target to $135 from $100 in a research note Thursday.  Analysts at Wedbush Securities were on the same page.

headline: 1 High-Flying Stock Worth Your Attention and 2 That Underwhelm
summary: Expensive stocks often command premium valuations because the market thinks their business models are exceptional. However, the downside is that high expectations are already baked into their prices, leaving little room for error if they stumble even slightly.

headline: Look Past the S&P 500’s Market Cap and Focus on Revenue Instead
summary: Traditional cap-weighted funds enshrine “buy high, sell low” behavior. Revenue weighting offers a simple potential solution.
